outputs.output_descr: Employment is a key factor in poverty reduction as well as prevention of social exclusion. The Project seeks to enhance integration into the labour market by developing models of accessible child care in rural areas,  and targeting the marginalized and people at social risk.  The new flexible and economically efficient models to be developed will be tested in eleven project locations, alongside other project activities such as motivational work with the project target group (single parents, families at social risk, large families, and long term unemployed women) and qualification raising training for social workers and other specialists as well as community volunteers working with families and children.

project_descr: Children care while parents at work: Groups' at risk integration into labour market while creating conditions for child care in rural neighbourhoods
project_title: Children Cared For - Parents at Work
